Package com.example.recipeoop_1.security

Class WebSecurityConfig

java.lang.Object
com.example.recipeoop_1.security.WebSecurityConfig
@Configuration @EnableWebSecurity @EnableMethodSecurity public class WebSecurityConfig extends Object
Spring Security configuration class for the application.

This class enables web security features and method-level security. It defines the security filter chain that handles HTTP security, including CSRF protection, request authorization, session management, and JWT token processing.

Annotations used:
  • Configuration: Indicates that this class contains Spring bean definitions.
  • EnableWebSecurity: Enables Spring Security's web security support and provides Spring MVC integration.
  • EnableMethodSecurity: Enables method-level security annotations like @PreAuthorize on controller methods.
Since:
2025-05-14

    • WebSecurityConfig

      @Autowired public WebSecurityConfig(JwtAuthenticationEntryPoint jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint, JwtRequestFilter jwtRequestFilter)
      Constructs the WebSecurityConfig with necessary JWT components.
      Parameters:
      jwtAuthenticationEntryPoint - The entry point to commence authentication when an AuthenticationException is thrown.
      jwtRequestFilter - The filter that processes JWT tokens from incoming requests.

  • Method Details

    • securityFilterChain

      @Bean public org.springframework.security.web.SecurityFilterChain securityFilterChain(org.springframework.security.config.annotation.web.builders.HttpSecurity http) throws Exception
      Configures the main SecurityFilterChain bean that defines the security rules for HTTP requests.

      The configuration includes:

      • Disabling CSRF (Cross-Site Request Forgery) protection, which is common for stateless REST APIs.
      • Defining authorization rules for various request matchers:
        • Permitting public access to static frontend content (root, HTML files), static resources (CSS, JS), the health check endpoint ("/health"), Javadoc documentation ("/apidocs/**"), and authentication endpoints ("/api/auth/**").
        • Restricting access to admin-specific recipe endpoints ("/api/recipes/admin/**") to users with the "ADMIN" role.
        • Requiring "USER" or "ADMIN" roles for general recipe API endpoints ("/api/recipes/**").
        • Requiring authentication for any other request not explicitly matched.
      • Setting up exception handling to use the JwtAuthenticationEntryPoint for authentication failures.
      • Configuring session management to be stateless, as JWTs are used for session handling.
      • Adding the JwtRequestFilter before the standard UsernamePasswordAuthenticationFilter to process JWTs in requests.
      Parameters:
      http - The HttpSecurity object to configure.
      Returns:
      The configured SecurityFilterChain.
      Throws:
      Exception - if an error occurs during the configuration.
